greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Kolakoski constant.
link: Rabie A. Mahmoud, Hardware Implementation of Binary Kolakoski Sequence, Research Gate, 2015.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Kolakoski Sequence
formula: Take the Kolakoski sequence (A000002) 1221121221.... Interpret the 2's as 1's and the 1's as 0's: 0110010110.... Interpret the result as a binary fraction: 0.110010110..._2.
mathematica: A000002[n_] := (s = {1, 2, 2}; Do[AppendTo[s, Mod[k-1, 2] + 1], {k, 3, n}, {s[[k]]}] ; s); Take[ First[ RealDigits[ FromDigits[ {Rest[A000002[300] /. {1 -> 0, 2 -> 1}], 0}, 2]]], 105] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 28 2011 *)
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_, Apr 21 2006
